snippet: The council adopted a resolution without a vote, calling for a team to be sent to Iraq to look into killings and other atrocities.
abstract: United Nations Human Rights Council decides to send fact-finding team to Iraq to investigate possible war crimes by Islamic State in Iraq and Syria militants.

byline.original: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE and SOMINI SENGUPTA
byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce reported from Geneva, and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: The council adopted a resolution without a vote, calling for a team to be sent to Iraq to look into killings and other atrocities.

headline.main: U.N. to Send Team to Iraq for Inquiry on ISIS Acts
headline.print_headline: U.N. to Send Team to Iraq for Inquiry on ISIS Acts

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
